alert.note: Alert for Alameda (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 12 at 2:47PM PDT by NWS Monterey
info.description: .The Alameda Creek near Niles is forecast to remain above flood stage into this evening. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding of Alameda Creek caused by excessive rainfall will continue. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following county, Alameda. * WHEN...Until 800 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of the Alameda Creek. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 245 PM PDT, Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.1 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fremont, Union City, Newark and Sunol. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Keep children away from storm drains, culverts, creeks and streams. Water levels can rise rapidly and sweep children away. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
